tweets.text: Good morning

tweets.author: Bethuel Mathebula
tweets.text:
A tsunami advisory has been issued 

To everyone along the coasts of Hokkaido, Aomori, Iwate, and Miyagi: Do not approach areas near the coast under any circumstances.

Please prioritize your safety in all actions

tweets.author: Nessa Aniete

tweets.text: Please be careful

tweets.author: CERTIFIED KOGI BOY
tweets.text:
Thank you for the tsunami advisory information m(_ _)m  
I'll be careful m(*_ _)m

tweets.author: Maxwell O
tweets.text: ä¸€æ–¹ã§ã€é©æ™‚ã®è­¦å ±ã§ã‚ã£ã¦ã‚‚ä½æ°‘ã®ä¸å®‰ã‚’é«˜ã‚ã‚‹å¯èƒ½æ€§ãŒã‚ã‚Šã€ãŸã¨ãˆå°è¦æ¨¡ãªæ´¥æ³¢ã§ã‚ã£ã¦ã‚‚ã€è¤‡æ•°ã®çœŒã§äº¤é€šã€æ¼æ¥­ã€æ—¥å¸¸ç”Ÿæ´»ã«æ”¯éšœã‚’ããŸã™ã“ã¨ãŒã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

tweets.author: NC
tweets.text: To everyone in the disaster-stricken areas, please take care and stay safe. May God's help be with you

tweets.author: Nessa Aniete
tweets.text: On the other hand, widespread alerts may cause confusion and overreactions in areas where the actual impact is small, and repeated warnings can lead to "alert fatigue," posing a risk of residents' responses becoming dulled.

thread_replies.author: ã¾ã£ã¡ã‚ƒã‚‚ã¡@Smartphone_phone
thread_replies.text:
Residents in the affected area,  
evacuate to high ground or sturdy buildings immediately!!

thread_replies.author: ç¾ãƒãŸã‚“é¦¬ã¨å‹ã«æ­©ã‚€é™ã‹ãªæš®ã‚‰ã—
thread_replies.text:
People in the disaster area, please make sure to evacuate properly without getting used to the earthquake or tsunami warnings.  
Even if you think it's okay, the situation can change. I know it's tough in the cold, but please evacuate when it's dangerous.

thread_replies.author: ã‚´ãƒ­3
thread_replies.text: A tsunami advisory has been issued. Please stay away from the coastal areas!!

thread_replies.author: YEBISU
thread_replies.text:
Why tsunami?
Was there an earthquake offshore at 11:52?

thread_replies.author: ä»
thread_replies.text:
Currently, there is a live real-time broadcast on NicoNico News on Twitter of the scene where this year's kanji character is being decided.

I don't know the seismic intensity of the earthquake, but it's better to be safe than sorry, so please evacuate to higher ground.
